Submodules

distrFitter module

src.sizing.distrFitter.generateDistr(area: [], power: [], interval: tuple, numberOfBins: int, shouldSave: bool, GP=False, Normal=False)[source]

Generates a distributions with parameters and saves it into numpy file.

Parameters:

  • area – array of area constraints

  • power – array of power constraints

  • interval – tuple - interval

  • numberOfBins – int - number of bins

  • shouldSave – boolean - true if should save into file, false otherwise

  • Normal – boolean - true if normal, false if lognormal

Return distros:

(numberOfDistros, NumberOfBins) np matrix of generated values

Return edges:

(1, numberOfBins + 1) np array of edges

src.sizing.distrFitter.linearRegression(distros, area, power, GP=False)[source]

Performs linear regression on the generated data

Parameters:

  • distros – (numberOfDistros, NumberOfBins) np matrix of generated values

  • area – array of area constraints

  • power – array of power constraints

Return coef:

(numberOfBins, 3) - 3 coeficients for each bins - 1. = b, 2. = area, 3. = power - reg([a, p]) = b + a* area + p* power

src.sizing.distrFitter.plotDistros(distros, edges)[source]

Plot distributions

Parameters:

  • distros – (numberOfDistros, NumberOfBins) np matrix of generated values

  • edges – (1, numberOfBins + 1) np array of edges

src.sizing.distrFitter.plotDistrosForInputs(a, f, e, GP=False)[source]
src.sizing.distrFitter.plotLinesForBin(distros, area, power, coef, bin, GP=False)[source]

Plot distros and lines

Parameters:

  • distros – (numberOfDistros, NumberOfBins) np matrix of generated values

  • area – array of area constraints

  • power – array of power constraints

  • coef – (numberOfBins, 3) - 3 coeficients for each bins - 1. = b, 2. = area, 3. = power - reg([a, p]) = b + a* area + p* power

src.sizing.distrFitter.saveModel(coef, GP=False, Normal=False)[source]

Saves model

Parameters:

  • coef – coeficients of the model

  • Normal – true if normal, false if lognormal

Returns:

None

mosekVariable module

class src.timing.mosekVariable.RandomVariableMOSEK(bins: array, edges: array, task: Task)[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a random variable given by histogram represented as MOSEK variable. Information about each variable is kept by their indices.

Class includes:

bins: numpy list of lists of integer indices to MOSEK variable list edges: len n+1 of histogram edges, dtype: 1-D np.array task: mosek.Task

convolution_UNARY_MAX_DIVIDE(secondVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr, withSymmetryConstr=False)[source]

Calculates convolution of 2 PDFs of random variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment. Works only for maximization task.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

  • curNofConstr – current number of MOSEK constraints - to know the indices

  • withSymmetryConstr – boolean whether a symmetry constraints should be included

Return convolutionClass:

class RandomVariableMOSEK with variables

Return newNofVariables:

integer, new total number of MOSEK variables

Return newNofConstr:

integer, new total number of MOSEK constraints

convolution_UNARY_MAX_DIVIDE_VECTORIZED(secondVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr, withSymmetryConstr=False, asMin=False)[source]

Calculates convolution of 2 PDFs of random variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

  • curNofConstr – current number of MOSEK constraints - to know the indices

  • withSymmetryConstr – boolean whether a symmetry constraints should be included

Return convolutionClass:

class RandomVariableMOSEK with variables

Return newNofVariables:

integer, new total number of MOSEK variables

Return newNofConstr:

integer, new total number of MOSEK constraints

static cutBins(edges: array, bins: {})[source]

Cuts bins depending on edge[0] if edge[0] < 0: cuts left bins and adds zeros to the end if edge[0] > 0: cuts right bins and adds zeros to the beginning Works for only unary random variable

Parameters:

  • edges – (1, n+1) numpy array of edges

  • bins – dictionary of dictionray of cp.Variables (1,1)

:returns None

maximum_AND_Convolution(secondVariable, thirdVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of random variable and a convolution with the third afterwards. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment. Works only for maximization problem

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • thirdVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one to convolve

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

  • curNofConstr – current number of MOSEK constraints - to know the indices

Return resultClass:

class RandomVariableMOSEK with mosek variables

Return newNofVariables:

integer, new total number of MOSEK variables

Return newNofConstr:

integer, new total number of MOSEK constraints

maximum_AND_Convolution_VECTORIZED(secondVariable, thirdVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of random variable and a convolution with the third afterwards. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment. Works only for maximization problem

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • thirdVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one to convolve

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

maximum_AND_Convolution_VECTORIZED_MEM_FREE(secondVariable, thirdVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of random variable and a convolution with the third afterwards. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment. This implementation works only for a maximization problem. Memory free version.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • thirdVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one to convolve

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

  • curNofConstr – current number of MOSEK constraints - to know the indices

Return resultClass:

class RandomVariableMOSEK with mosek variables

Return newNofVariables:

integer, new total number of MOSEK variables

Return newNofConstr:

integer, new total number of MOSEK constraints

maximum_AND_Convolution_VECTORIZED_MIN(secondVariable, thirdVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr, VAR=False)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of random variable and a convolution with the third afterwards. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment. This implementation works only for a minimization problem.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one of maximums

  • thirdVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK - one to convolve

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

  • curNofConstr – current number of MOSEK constraints - to know the indices

maximum_UNARY_MAX_DIVIDE(secondVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr, withSymmetryConstr=False)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the ‘quadratic’ algorithm and unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

  • curNofConstr – current number of MOSEK constraints - to know the indices

  • withSymmetryConstr – boolean whether a symmetry constraints should be included

Return maximumClass:

class RandomVariableMOSEK with variables (1, 1)

Return newNofVariables:

integer, new total number of MOSEK variables

Return newNofConstr:

integer, new total number of MOSEK constraints

maximum_UNARY_MAX_DIVIDE_MEM_FREE(secondVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr, numberOfUnarie, withSymmetryConstr=False)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of random variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment. Memory free means we do not create new matrix - instead pass the indicies - too big scaling, and does not work well

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

  • curNofConstr – current number of MOSEK constraints - to know the indices

  • withSymmetryConstr – boolean whether a symmetry constraints should be included

Return maximumClass:

class RandomVariableMOSEK with variables

Return newNofVariables:

integer, new total number of MOSEK variables

Return newNofConstr:

integer, new total number of MOSEK constraints

maximum_UNARY_MAX_DIVIDE_VECTORIZED(secondVariable, curNofVariables, curNofConstr, withSymmetryConstr=False, asMin=False)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of random variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison. Is in MOSEK environment.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableMOSEK

  • curNofVariables – current number of MOSEK variables - to know the indices

src.timing.SSTA.calculateCircuitDelay(rootNodes: [<class 'src.other.node.Node'>], cvxpy=False, unary=False, mosekStatus=(-1, -1), withSymmetryConstr=False, mosekTRI=False, GP=False, monteCarlo=False) → [<class 'src.other.node.Node'>][source]

Compute circuit delay using SSTA algorithm Function executes the algorithm for finding out the PDF of a circuit delay.

Parameters:

  • rootNodes – array of root nodes, [Node], Node includes next nodes and previous nodes

  • mosekStatus – current number of MOSEK variables and constraints (tuple)

  • cvxpy – Bool, true if cvxpy objects are used, false if just RandomVariables class is used

  • unary – Bool, true if unary (M 0/1-bin repr.) is used, false otherwise

  • mosekTRI – Bool, true if trilinear constraints are used, false otherwise

  • GP – Bool, true if using the GP version of the SSTA, false otherwise

  • monteCarlo – Bool, true if using the monte carlo, false otherwise

Return newConstr:

new constraints for CVXPY(optional)

Return newNofVariables:

new number of MOSEK variables(optional)

Return newDelays:

array of new RVs

src.timing.SSTA.maxMonteCarlo(delays)[source]

Calculates maximum for monte carlo

cvxpyVariable module

class src.timing.cvxpyVariable.RandomVariableCVXPY(bins: array, edges: array, lowerBounds: array = array([], dtype=float64))[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a random variable given by histogram represented as CVXPY dictionary. Class also includes functions for convolution and maximum.

Class includes:

bins: len n of frequencies, dictionary of dictionary with cvxpy variables (1, 1) edges: len n+1 of histogram edges, dtype: 1-D np.array lowerBounds: numpy array of lowerbounds values, not a mandatory atribute

convolution_GP(secondVariable, constr)[source]

Calculates convolution of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the ‘quadratic’ algorithm and GP programming

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY

Return convClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy slack variables (1, 1)

Return constr:

python array with inequalities - for computing the convolution

convolution_GP_OPT(secondVariable, constr)[source]

Calculates convolution of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the ‘quadratic’ algorithm and GP programming - optimized version

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY

Return convClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy auxiliary variables (1, 1)

Return constr:

python array with inequalities - for computing the convolution

convolution_McCormick(secondVariable)[source]

Calculates convolution of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the ‘quadratic’ algorithm and McCormick envelopes .. important:: WORKS ONLY FOR MINIMIZATION PROBLEM

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY

Return maximumClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy slack variables (1, 1)

Return MaxConstraints:

python array with inequalities - for computing the maximum

convolution_UNARY_CUT(secondVariable, withSymmetryConstr=False, asMin=False)[source]

Calculates convolution of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the information cutting. Maximization is always feasible, minimization is not.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • asMin – boolean, true for minimization problem, false for maximization problem

  • withSymmetryConstr – boolean whether a symmetry constraints should be included

Return convolutionClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy slack variables

Return ConvConstraints:

python array with inequalities - for computing the convolution

convolution_UNARY_DIVIDE(secondVariable, withSepConstr=False, asMin=False)[source]

Calculates convolution of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the divison.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • asMin – boolean, true for minimization problem, false for maximization problem

  • withSepConstr – boolean whether a separation constraints should be included

Return convolutionClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy slack variables

Return ConvConstraints:

python array with inequalities - for computing the convolution

  • bins – dictionary of dictionray of cp.Variables (1,1)

:returns None

Parameters:

  • bins – dictionary of dictionary of cp.Variables (1,1)

maximum_FORM_UNARY_OLD_MAX(secondVariable, withSymmetryConstr=False)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the ‘formula’ algorithm and unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. This approach is significantly slower giving the same results. .. important:: WORKS ONLY FOR MAXIMIZATION PROBLEM

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • withSymmetryConstr – boolean whether a symmetry constraints should be included

Return maximumClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy slack variables (1, 1)

Return MaxConstraints:

python array with inequalities - for computing the maximum

maximum_QUAD_UNARY_CUT(secondVariable, asMin=False, withSymmetryConstr=False)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the ‘quadratic’ algorithm and unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. Unarization is kept using the information cutting. Maximization is always feasible, minimization is not.

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY :param withSymmetryConstr: boolean whether a symmetry constraints should be included

  • asMin – boolean, true for minimization problem, false for maximization problem

Return maximumClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy slack variables (1, 1)

Return MaxConstraints:

python array with inequalities - for computing the maximum

python array with inequalities - for computing the maximum

maximum_QUAD_UNARY_OLD(secondVariable)[source]

Calculates maximum of 2 PDFs of cvxpy variable. Works only for 2 identical edges. Is computed using the ‘quadratic’ algorithm and unary representation of bins - M 0/1-bins for each bin. This is an old implementation.

WARNING: this is an old version which does not work after more steps

Parameters:

  • self – class RandomVariableCVXPY

  • secondVariable – class RandomVariableCVXPY

Return maximumClass:

class RandomVariableCVXPY with cvxpy slack variables (1, 1)

Return MaxConstraints:

python array with inequalities - for computing the maximum

  • sigma – std

  • numberOfSamples – number of samples used for generating

  • numberOfSamples – number of samples used for generating

src.sizing.optimizeGatesVectorized_Boyd.getConstrCload(capLoad, loadCapacitances)[source]

Function gets capacitance load constraint. Load capacitances of end gates are given, cannot set due to cvxpy expression - it is set as an constraint instead.

Parameters:

  • capLoad – (1, n) cvxpy variable of capacitance load

  • loadCapacitances – (1, m) array of load capacitances of output gates

Return constr_cload:

(1, m) load cap. constr.

src.sizing.optimizeGatesVectorized_Boyd.getConstrTiming(Aout, Ain, gateDelays, t: Variable, x)[source]
Timing constraints.

Aout’ * t + Ain’ * gateDelays <= Ain’ * t

These constraints enforce t_j + d_j <= t_i over all gates j that drive gate i.

For gates with inputs not connected to other gates we enforce d_i <= t_i

Parameters:

  • Aout – (n, m) cvxpy variable of capacitance load

  • Ain – (n, m) array of load capacitances of output gates

  • gateDelays – (1, m) array of load capacitances of output gates

  • t – (1, m) of cvxpy variable of timing

Return constr_cload:

(1, m) load cap. constr.

src.sizing.optimizeGatesVectorized_Boyd.getInputTimingConstr(gateDelays: Expression, t: Variable) → [<class 'bool'>][source]

Get timing constraints for gate delays

Parameters:

  • gateDelays – (1, n) cvxpy variable of gate delays

  • t – (1, n) cvxpy variable of timing

Return timing_constr:

(1, n) cvxpy expression of timing constr.

randomVariableHist_Numpy module

class src.timing.randomVariableHist_Numpy.RandomVariable(bins, edges, unary=False)[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a random variable given by histogram. Class also includes histogram operations with histograms.

Class includes:

bins: len n of frequencies edges: len n+1 of histogram edges mean: computed sample mean variance: computed sample variance

calculateMean()[source]

Function calculates sample mean of the random variable. Calculation: weighted average of the frequencies, edges being the weights

Parameters:

self – random variable class

double value

convolutionOfTwoVarsNaiveFULL(secondVariable)[source]
‘Full’ Convolution of two independent random variables naively - using 2 for loops:

(f*g)(z) = sum{k=-inf, inf} ( f(k)g(z-k) )

Parameters:

  • self – random variable class

  • secondVariable – random variable class

Return convolution:

random variable class of convolution

convolutionOfTwoVarsNaiveSAME(secondVariable)[source]

(f*g)(z) = sum{k=-inf, inf} ( f(k)g(z-k) )

Parameters:

  • self – random variable class

  • secondVariable – random variable class

Return convolution:

random variable class of convolution

convolutionOfTwoVarsNaiveSAME_UNARY(secondVariable)[source]
‘SAME’ Convolution of two independent random variables naively - using 2 for loops:

(f*g)(z) = sum{k=-inf, inf} ( f(k)g(z-k) )

with unary bins - meaning each bin is represented by M 0/1-bins. M and number of bins is same for all variables Uses division to get into unary form.

Parameters:

  • self – random variable class

  • secondVariable – random variable class

Return convolution:

random variable class of convolution

static cutBins(E, alpha)[source]

Cuts bins depending on edge[0] if edge[0] < 0: cuts left bins and adds zeros to the end if edge[0] > 0: cuts right bins and adds zeros to the beginning

Parameters:

  • E – (1, n+1) numpy array of edges

  • alpha – (1, n) numpy array of bins

:returns None

static unarizeCut(bins)[source]

Make a non unarized histogram in the unary form. This is done using cutting the additional information. Please see ‘unarizeDivide’ for a better alternative.

static unarizeDivide(bins, convolution, TRI=False)[source]

Make a non unarized histogram in the unary form. This is done using the divison of the numbers.
